intro: Charidion, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Charidion is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
